column4: can anyone tell me is there any application available in ubuntu like teamviewer, through which i can use a remote machine and do tasks????
More than what's available in the Remote Desktop Viewer in Applications / Internet?
Or Terminal Server Client (same place) - They were installed by default on my Ubuntu install.
Yup. Some vnc servers even serve a java applet vnc client if you want.
There's probably one installed already, it's just not called vncviewer.
See for example Terminal Services Client
sorry, Terminal Server Client.
i think that is rdesktop or tsclient? right?
It does VNC protocol, and (at least for me) it was installed in the default Ubuntu installation
Yeah, tsclient
If you start terminal server client, there's a choice for protocol, you can choose VNC.
but which protocol should i use for windows remotee desktop
RDP
ok
rdpv5 or just rdp?
That I don't know.
I think it depends on the version of the server on the other end.
Ah, if you hover over the choices... it says
RDPv5 for connecting to XP or newer, RDP for 2000 and before.
thanx
dude on more question, what if the user doent have password
Hmmm. Don't think I've tried RDP w/o a password. Does it not let you leave it blank?
haven't tried yet
actually my frnd is etting up his XP yet
